author: Jordan Darensbourg
title: Drought Update: Modest improvements in the Hill Country, portions of Williamson County
text:
AUSTIN, Texas â€” As expected,
[the rainfall that fell](/article/weather/forecast/austin-weather-central-texas-forecast/269-43840919) just prior to Christmas has had a somewhat positive effect on our drought situation locally, as well as across the Lone Star State.
While we did not see much change in the Austin metro area, areas of the Hill Country and Williamson County did see some improvements.
Most notably, portions of Mason County, including the City of Mason, are now under "abnormally dry" conditions, which is down from the "moderate" drought category. In Williamson County, the northwest corner of the county is now in the "severe" drought category, which is down from the "extreme" category.
When looking at a statewide view of the drought, conditions have markedly improved, with all drought levels showing improving conditions. Most notably, north and east Texas, where most of the rain from the recent system fell, saw the biggest improvements statewide. The largest categorical improvement was in the "abnormally dry" category, where a five-percent decrease was observed. Additionally, areas not in a drought category increased by five percent as well. The "moderate" drought category also saw a large improvement, dropping by around 3.5% statewide.
With rain expected for the first week of 2024, we don't expect much change on the drought monitor for next Thursday's release, which will be the first of the new year. However, we'll be watching the monitor for January 11th, which will include next week's rainfall amounts.
Stick with KVUE for the latest as we track the potential for the drought to improve this winter with the El Nino pattern.
In the meantime, here's your seven-day forecast.

author: Patrick McNamara
title: Thomas Mertonâ€™s Blueprint for a More Contemplative Life
text:
Thomas Mertonâ€™s Blueprint for a More Contemplative Life
By age 25, my grandmother had accompanied her mother in marching for womenâ€™s suffrage, lived through World War I, survived the Great Depression, and served in the Navy during World War II. After she died in 2009, a box of her favorite books passed down to me, her youngest grandchild. I imagined the box would be filled with stories matching the pace of her early life. Instead, it only contained books written by Thomas Merton, her favorite being The Seven Storey Mountain, the trappist monkâ€™s spiritual autobiography.
What about the life a monk could appeal to a woman who lived through the 20th centuryâ€™s most significant events? Subjects like spirituality and the interior life remain elusive by nature, but Mertonâ€™s story and works offer my grandmotherâ€™s generation and modern readers a guiding light on the journey for peace. As this year marked The Seven Storey Mountainâ€™s 75th anniversary, itâ€™s worth thinking through the life of a man whose influence would sprawl the likes of
Dorothy Day, Evelyn Waugh, and who almost held a retreat with Martin Luther King Jr. before his assassination.
Born in 1915, Merton had an upbringing that paralleled my grandmotherâ€™s (and was in fact born just a year after her). From his early years to his time at Columbia University, Merton witnessed some of the major political, intellectual, and artistic movements of the 1930s. He frequented fervorous spaces, from communist meetups to anti-war protests. Some of his closest friendsâ€”the poet Robert Lax, the editor Robert Giroux, and the painter Ad Reinhardtâ€”went on to be influential in the New York art scene. Mertonâ€™s college years teemed with thrills, love affairs, and partying in New York.
Itâ€™s tempting to romanticize this as a glamorous era, but Merton lamented this time of his life. â€œIn devouring pleasures and joys,â€ he writes in The Seven Storey Mountain, â€œI had found distress and anguish and fear.â€ Despite his rich and varied experiences, Merton regarded this seemingly appealing life as an illusion: In gulping down the pleasures the world offered, he found himself still thirsty.

author: Fernando de Lama
title: La DANA roza Ibiza y la Aemet sube la alerta a naranja
text: La DANA que ha golpeado en los Ãºltimos dÃ­as todo el litoral mediterrÃ¡neo espaÃ±ol sigue activa y en las Ãºltimas horas se ha situado en el mar al norte de la isla. Aemet ha elevado la alerta amarilla a naranja porque se prevÃ©n episodios de alrededor de 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora. El riesgo naranja permanecerÃ¡ activo hasta las 20 horas de este viernes dÃ­a festivo de Tots Sants. Las lluvias han descargado con fuerza en algunos puntos de la isla desde primera hora de la maÃ±ana, ya que la tormenta ha barrido buena parte de la isla. Sobre todo en la zona norte, con chubascos potentes en la zona de Sant Vicent, Sant Joan y entre Santa AgnÃ¨s y Sant Mateu. Pero tambiÃ©n se han producido lluvias intensas en otros puntos, como el Pla de Sant Antoni, en Santa EulÃ ria hacia el interior e incluso en puntos aislados de Sant Josep y en la ciudad de Eivissa, donde se han producido algunas inundaciones. TambiÃ©n en las Ãºltimas horas se han producido tormentas en Formentera. Se recomienda no estar en zonas inundables ni utilizar las carreteras, ya que es un fenÃ³meno impredecible que puede descargar tormentas y provocar inundaciones en pocos minutos. Desde las 9 de la maÃ±ana tambiÃ©n han descargado decenas de rayos en diferentes puntos de la isla. Aunque el grueso de la DANA sigue afectando desde anoche principalmente a la zona de CastellÃ³n y el Sur de Tarragona, se ha ido desplazando hacia el MediterrÃ¡neo y un frente estÃ¡ situado durante toda la madrugada y la maÃ±ana entre Ibiza y Mallorca. Ante la emergencia meteorolÃ³gica para este dÃ­a de Tots Sants, el Govern balear ha reclamado â€œmÃ¡xima prudenciaâ€ a los ciudadanos â€œlas prÃ³ximas horas y dÃ­asâ€ por la alerta naranja decretada. Se recomienda que se tomen precauciones y mantenerse informado de la predicciÃ³n meteorolÃ³gica mÃ¡s actualizada. Las actividades habituales y al aire libre pueden verse alteradas. El Servicio de Emergencias 112 ha activado el Ãndice de Gravedad 1 (IG1) del Plan Meteobal por lluvias y tormentas en Ibiza, Formentera, Mallorca y Menorca.

author: hindi.sportskeeda.com
title: Elijah Moore injury update vs Browns: Latest on WR after scary fall on TNF
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Elijah Moore Injury Update vs Browns: Latest on WR after scary fall on TNF Like what you are reading? Unlock the Full Story for Free! Sign in with Google Continue with Facebook Login using other methods Elijah Moore suffered a scary injury for the Cleveland Browns against the New York Jets on Thursday Night Football. It looked like an innocuous play as the wide receiver was tackled after a catch and run during the two-minute warning in the first half.
But his head slammed into the ground and he did not get up immediately. As the cameras zoomed in, showing his helmet having picked up a divot of the turf, he was seen making what looked like involuntary movements. It was immediately clear that it was serious and the play was stopped for more than a minute as the medical staff attended to him. Players from both teams, especially given Elijah Moore is a former Jets player, huddled on their knees around him.
Note: Some can find the below video distressing, viewer discretion is advised
â€¢
70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) 70% Win (110-25-1) Unlock Free tips from our Experts Get Picks Now Expand Tweet Elijah Moore's injury update Elijah Moore, thankfully, could get up and walk on his own to the blue tent to be evaluated. But it was later confirmed that the head injury he suffered was enough to remove his involvement in the game.
Expand Tweet It's tough news for the Browns, given they already have Amari Cooper missing. If Elijah Moore misses more time due to concussion protocol, it could have a detrimental effect on their offense.
Former Jets combine to bring joy to the Browns on TNF The loss of Elijah Moore came at a time when the Browns were dominant against the Jets. They were already leading 27-17, and soon it was 34-17.
One of the touchdowns was scored by the wide receiver from a pass from Joe Flacco . Both these players were with the New York Jets last season. In a retooled offense after acquiring Aaron Rodgers from the Green Bay Packers , they were deemed dispensable.
Yet, it is Cleveland that is on the way to the postseason. It is sweet revenge for the ex-Jets players but scoring when playing against them would have been the cherry on the top.
Worryingly for the Browns, though, their injuries are now racking up. It is not just they are now down two of their best receivers for this game and maybe more, but it is all around. Joe Flacco is, of course, playing in place of Deshaun Watson , who is out for the season.
Additionally, after kicker Dustin Hopkins was injured in the game against the Houston Texans , they acquired Riley Patterson who missed both a field goal and a one-point conversion today. Their punter was also injured in the previous week. They are limping toward the postseason and they could catch up in the playoffs.
